content.1: Now Sarai Abram’s wife bare him no children: and she had an handmaid, an Egyptian, whose name
content.2: And Sarai said unto Abram, Behold now, the
content.3: And Sarai Abram’s wife took Hagar her maid the Egyptian, after Abram had dwelt ten years in the land of Canaan, and gave her to her husband Abram to be his wife.
content.4: And he went in unto Hagar, and she conceived: and when she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.
content.5: And Sarai said unto Abram, My wrong
content.6: But Abram said unto Sarai, Behold, thy maid
content.8: And he said, Hagar, Sarai’s maid, whence camest thou? and whither wilt thou go? And she said, I flee from the face of my mistress Sarai.
content.12: And he will be a wild man; his hand
content.13: And she called the name of the
content.14: Wherefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi; behold,
content.15: And Hagar bare Abram a son: and Abram called his son’s name, which Hagar bare, Ishmael.
